        • pycheron.metrics.deadChanADFMetric

    pycheron.metrics.deadChanADFMetric¶

    deadChanADFMetric(st, win_size=500, pvalue_thresh=0.01, threshold=1.5, generateMasks=False, masksByTime=True, use_thresh='pvalue', database=None)[source]¶

    DeadChannelMetric test using the Augmented Dickey Fuller Test

    Parameters:
    • st (obspy.core.stream.Stream) – obspy stream object to run Augmented Dickey Fuller (ADF) Test on
    • win_size (int) – window size to increment the data by in samples, each window will have a ADF run on it (assumes 100sps). If None, window size determined by sample rate of each trace in the stream object
    • pvalue_threshold – p value threshold to trigger ADF rejection of null hypothesis (e.g., time series is assumed stationary with rejection of null hypothesis)
    • threshold (float) – threshold to trigger ADF rejection of null hypothesis using difference between DF test statistic and 1% critical value
    • generateMasks (bool) – Generate boolean qc mask array
    • masksByTime (bool) – Generate a time-based qc mask list
    • use_thresh (str) – String option for choosing whether to use the pvalue_threshold or the threshold for determining whether null hypothesis fails. Options are pvalue or diffs.
    • database (pycheron.db.sqllite_db.Database) – database object
    Returns:

    Returns list of dictionaries that includes the following for each trace within the stream:

    • dead_channel_times (list) - Lists of dicts with dead channel start/endtime
    • end_time (str) - end time of trace
    • start_time (str) - start time of trace
    • masks (list or numpy.ndarray) - masks for that trace, which is either a boolean array or a list of start/stop times in UTC
    • metric_name (str) - deadChanADFMetric string
    • snlcq (str) - station network location channel information for the specific trace
    Return type:

    list

    The Augmented Dickey Fuller (ADF) Test is unit root test for stationarity. Rejection of the ADF Test implies that the data within the window are stationary. Acceptance of the ADF test, implies unit root, or a non-stationary time series. The ADF in this case is used to find areas within the time series that are stationary (statistical properties such as mean, variance, autocorrelation, etc. are all constant over time) and mark them as a deadChannel QC issue.
